<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/tesla-hits-usd1-trillion-dollar-market-cap-after-hertz-order?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hertz Sends Tesla to the $Top
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/tesla-hits-usd1-trillion-dollar-market-cap-after-hertz-order?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Yellow Tesla on a pedastal with "$1 trillion" on front with confetti' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1f9ebadd38368ca4b2d9749b06c3e9f092d67e9e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While most of us spent yesterday eating all the candy we planned to give out on Halloween, Elon Musk was busy making auto history. After Hertz ordered 100,000 of Tesla’s electric vehicles, the automaker’s share price jumped 12.7%, giving it a market capitalization of $1 trillion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Only Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Microsoft have ever received the golden ticket to the four comma club in the US. Facebook hit $1 trillion the fastest of all (within 17 years of being founded), but Tesla is currently worth about $83 billion more than the social media company. It took Tesla 18 years after its founding to reach the milestone.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tesla + Hertz = Largest Deal EVer </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last spring, when no one was traveling and rental cars sat idle in parking lots, Hertz filed for bankruptcy. But like a phoenix rising from the charred remains of a 2019 Chevy Malibu, the rental car company <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hertz-glo-hldg-chapter-11-knighthead/hertz-picks-knighthead-certares-and-apollo-to-fund-bankruptcy-exit-idUSKBN2CT1Q7?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reorganized</a> and said, “No going home, just going big.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How big? </strong>Hertz’s purchase of the Teslas, reportedly worth $4.2 billion, is the largest EV deal in history. With it, Teslas could make up over 20% of Hertz’s entire fleet while offering the EV-curious more opportunities to test them out. Hertz Interim CEO Mark Fields <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/10/25/1048953565/hertz-will-buy-100-000-teslas-electric-vehicles?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that “electric vehicles are now mainstream” and adoption has only just begun.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Zooming out on the auto race</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not even close. If we’re measuring by market capitalization, which is used to approximate a company’s worth, Tesla is Lewis Hamilton and the competition is your grandma.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tesla is </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/JonErlichman/status/1452710605647925252?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth as much as</a></span><span> 19 other automakers, including Toyota, GM, Honda, and Nissan, combined.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tesla’s value is </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/eliotwb/status/1452683820516265985?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15x</a></span><span> higher than Ford’s, even though Ford brought in $115+ billion more in revenue last year.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla’s wide lead over its rivals shows that investors believe the future of the auto industry lies in electric vehicles, and that Elon Musk’s company is poised to capture a big chunk of that market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for Mr. Musk...</strong>he’s shopping with the price filter set high to low. Thanks to Tesla’s surging share price, Musk’s fortune increased by $25.6 billion yesterday to hit $255.2 billion—richer than any billionaire Forbes has ever tracked.</p>
<img class="img-responsive" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fbc02c7b3fca60b1cf40a94b493b358491c8ef8a-512x131.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format" alt='Tweet from Elon musk "Wild $T1imes!"' style="width:100% !important"><p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/facebook-posts-solid-revenue-growth-in-q3-looks-to-retool-to-attract-younger-users?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook to Critics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/facebook-posts-solid-revenue-growth-in-q3-looks-to-retool-to-attract-younger-users?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A rugby player stiff-arming defenders" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=416 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-25/image-98c63049c0103c0591cdbaaa15cc80a3348eaf17-480x298-gif/giphy(9).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A rugby player stiff-arming defenders" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-25/image-98c63049c0103c0591cdbaaa15cc80a3348eaf17-480x298-gif/giphy(9).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thousands of pages of leaked research. Reports blaring of an “existential crisis.” Apple’s privacy updates hurting ad visibility. And yet, the Zuck machine keeps growing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook said Q3 revenue <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/25/facebook-fb-q3-earnings-report.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 35%</a> from last year, and that 3.58 billion people worldwide use its apps, up 12% from the year prior. Investors sent shares up nearly 2% after hours, relieved that FB continues to grow sales and users despite its regulatory and PR nightmares.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">About those PR nightmares: </strong>Dozens of publications have been releasing damning reports of the company’s practices based on documents provided by whistleblower Frances Haugen. An agitated CEO Mark Zuckerberg <a href="https://twitter.com/issielapowsky/status/1452743300910288902?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">labeled it</a> a “coordinated effort to selectively use leaked documents to paint a false picture of our company” on the earnings call.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Zuck knows he’s getting creamed by rivals like TikTok in engaging younger users, so he said the company will be “retooling” its products over the next few years to make “serving young adults the north star, rather than optimizing for older people.”—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/blue-origin-plans-to-launch-a-private-space-station-within-the-decade?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Space, Available for Lease
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/blue-origin-plans-to-launch-a-private-space-station-within-the-decade?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A computer generated image of Blue Origin's planned private space station orbiting earth" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9d1246df8d245a5fc777961e9d5dfcb404d3d5ec-3000x1688.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Orbital Reef/Blue Origin</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The infinite vastness of space, now with kombucha on tap. Yesterday, Blue Origin unveiled its plans to launch Orbital Reef, a private space station it describes as a “<a href="https://www.orbitalreef.com/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mixed-use business park</a>,” between 2025 and 2030.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think of Orbital Reef as a kind of “Starship WeWork”—the station’s design will feature distinct quarters for living and working, enabling it to be leased out for work, research, and tourism.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Orbital Reef would be nearly as spacious as the International Space Station and be habitable for up to 10 people.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Blue Origin isn't free soloing this project: </strong>Its primary partner is Sierra Space, a subsidiary of the Sierra Nevada Corporation (not to be confused with the pale ale). Blue Origin will launch Orbital Reef and provide its utility systems, while Sierra Space will transport cargo and crew to and from the station.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Orbital Reef isn’t the only private space station in the works. Space startup Nanoracks announced plans to help replace NASA’s orbital laboratory with its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-21/nasa-gets-a-third-proposal-for-a-new-private-space-station?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Starlab station in 2027</a>, and Axiom plans to launch a module to attach to the ISS in 2024 (and eventually separate from it as the station is retired).—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Alibaba founder Jack Ma criticized Chinese financial regulators in a bombshell speech on October 24, 2020. In the year since, the e-commerce giant <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-25/alibaba-s-value-drop-tops-the-world-one-year-after-ma-s-speech?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost $344 billion</a> in market cap, the biggest drop in value of any company in the world, Bloomberg reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We are way off track.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s how the head of the UN’s World Meteorological Organization described the findings of a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/cop/world-scrambles-contain-damage-greenhouse-gas-emissions-hit-record-2021-10-25/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new climate report</a>, which showed that greenhouse gas concentrations hit a record high in 2020...despite pandemic lockdowns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>What’s the deal with fictional influencers? (<a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/22734620/fictional-influencers-fourfront-fake-tiktokers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a>)</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/faze-clan-is-valued-at-1-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Esports: Not Just a FaZe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/faze-clan-is-valued-at-1-billion?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Team FaZe Clan during a break in between games against team OpTic Gaming during Call of Duty World League at Anaheim Convention Center on June 16, 2019 in Anaheim, California." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/938d675ec3d3de895411f352624372cdc3d09938-1024x691.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kevork Djansezian/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gone are the days of companies started in garages. Now, they begin as YouTube channels full of <em>Call of Duty </em>killshot videos and eventually <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/youth-focused-digital-platform-faze-clan-nears-1-billion-spac-deal-to-go-public-11635154201?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">become unicorns</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s the story of FaZe Clan, at least. The esports/gaming culture company will go public via SPAC at a $1 billion valuation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pretty influential: </strong>FaZe Clan claims to have a community of 350 million across its social channels, with 80% of the members between the ages of 13–34. And it’s partnered with basically every company under the sun hungry to reach that youthful audience: McDonald’s, DC Comics, General Mills, and Champion, to name a handful.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But FaZe’s recognizable partnerships don’t stop at brands. The company’s <a href="https://www.si.com/tech-media/2021/06/10/daily-cover-faze-clan-kyler-murray-bronny-james?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">part-owners</a> include Pitbull, Offset, skateboarder Nyjah Huston, and NBA stars Ben Simmons and Jamal Murray. Cardinals QB Kyler Murray and LeBron James Jr. are also members of the FaZe Clan.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, the company announced the creation of an entertainment studio called <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/digital/faze-clan-sugar23-team-launch-new-studio-1291729/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FaZe Studios</a>, focused on feature films and scripted TV that gels with the “aspirational gaming lifestyle” brand.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">FaZe Clan will hit the Nasdaq in 2022 with the ticker symbol (what else) FAZE.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHertz Sends Tesla to the $Top\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/25/tesla-hits-usd1-trillion-dollar-market-cap-after-hertz-order?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='Yellow Tesla on a pedastal with \"$1 trillion\" on front with confetti' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1f9ebadd38368ca4b2d9749b06c3e9f092d67e9e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile most of us spent yesterday eating all the candy we planned to give out on Halloween, Elon Musk was busy making auto history. After Hertz ordered 100,000 of Tesla’s electric vehicles, the automaker’s share price jumped 12.7%, giving it a market capitalization of $1 trillion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnly Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Microsoft have ever received the golden ticket to the four comma club in the US. Facebook hit $1 trillion the fastest of all (within 17 years of being founded), but Tesla is currently worth about $83 billion more than the social media company. It took Tesla 18 years after its founding to reach the milestone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTesla + Hertz = Largest Deal EVer \u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast spring, when no one was traveling and rental cars sat idle in parking lots, Hertz filed for bankruptcy. But like a phoenix rising from the charred remains of a 2019 Chevy Malibu, the rental car company \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hertz-glo-hldg-chapter-11-knighthead/hertz-picks-knighthead-certares-and-apollo-to-fund-bankruptcy-exit-idUSKBN2CT1Q7?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereorganized\u003c/a\u003e and said, “No going home, just going big.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow big? \u003c/strong\u003eHertz’s purchase of the Teslas, reportedly worth $4.2 billion, is the largest EV deal in history. With it, Teslas could make up over 20% of Hertz’s entire fleet while offering the EV-curious more opportunities to test them out. Hertz Interim CEO Mark Fields \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/10/25/1048953565/hertz-will-buy-100-000-teslas-electric-vehicles?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that “electric vehicles are now mainstream” and adoption has only just begun.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eZooming out on the auto race\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not even close. If we’re measuring by market capitalization, which is used to approximate a company’s worth, Tesla is Lewis Hamilton and the competition is your grandma.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTesla is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/JonErlichman/status/1452710605647925252?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworth as much as\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 19 other automakers, including Toyota, GM, Honda, and Nissan, combined.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTesla’s value is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/eliotwb/status/1452683820516265985?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e15x\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e higher than Ford’s, even though Ford brought in $115+ billion more in revenue last year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla’s wide lead over its rivals shows that investors believe the future of the auto industry lies in electric vehicles, and that Elon Musk’s company is poised to capture a big chunk of that market. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for Mr. Musk...\u003c/strong\u003ehe’s shopping with the price filter set high to low. Thanks to Tesla’s surging share price, Musk’s fortune increased by $25.6 billion yesterday to hit $255.2 billion—richer than any billionaire Forbes has ever tracked.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"img-responsive\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fbc02c7b3fca60b1cf40a94b493b358491c8ef8a-512x131.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\" alt='Tweet from Elon musk \"Wild $T1imes!\"' style=\"width:100% !important\"\u003e\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThousands of pages of leaked research. Reports blaring of an “existential crisis.” Apple’s privacy updates hurting ad visibility. And yet, the Zuck machine keeps growing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook said Q3 revenue \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/25/facebook-fb-q3-earnings-report.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 35%\u003c/a\u003e from last year, and that 3.58 billion people worldwide use its apps, up 12% from the year prior. Investors sent shares up nearly 2% after hours, relieved that FB continues to grow sales and users despite its regulatory and PR nightmares.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAbout those PR nightmares: \u003c/strong\u003eDozens of publications have been releasing damning reports of the company’s practices based on documents provided by whistleblower Frances Haugen. An agitated CEO Mark Zuckerberg \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/issielapowsky/status/1452743300910288902?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elabeled it\u003c/a\u003e a “coordinated effort to selectively use leaked documents to paint a false picture of our company” on the earnings call.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eZuck knows he’s getting creamed by rivals like TikTok in engaging younger users, so he said the company will be “retooling” its products over the next few years to make “serving young adults the north star, rather than optimizing style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eOrbital Reef/Blue Origin\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe infinite vastness of space, now with kombucha on tap. Yesterday, Blue Origin unveiled its plans to launch Orbital Reef, a private space station it describes as a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.orbitalreef.com/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emixed-use business park\u003c/a\u003e,” between 2025 and 2030.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink of Orbital Reef as a kind of “Starship WeWork”—the station’s design will feature distinct quarters for living and working, enabling it to be leased out for work, research, and tourism.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOrbital Reef would be nearly as spacious as the International Space Station and be habitable for up to 10 people.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBlue Origin isn't free soloing this project: \u003c/strong\u003eIts primary partner is Sierra Space, a subsidiary of the Sierra Nevada Corporation (not to be confused with the pale ale). Blue Origin will launch Orbital Reef and provide its utility systems, while Sierra Space will transport cargo and crew to and from the station.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOrbital Reef isn’t the only private space station in the works. Space startup Nanoracks announced plans to help replace NASA’s orbital laboratory with its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-21/nasa-gets-a-third-proposal-for-a-new-private-space-station?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eStarlab station in 2027\u003c/a\u003e, and Axiom plans to launch a module to attach to the ISS in 2024 (and eventually separate from it as the station is retired).—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
